description: Etobicoke is a relaxed area along the Humber River. It's saturated with green spaces and conservatories, making it a premier destination for outdoor sports, hiking, and nature walks. Its abundance of parkland and lakes makes it a typical spot for fishing, picnicking, and camping out, especially in warmer months. The peaceful area is also enjoyed by families, who appreciate its boardwalks and sports facilities. Locals enjoy the variety of golfing and country club opportunities, which also provide lessons for golfers of any skill level.

reviews.title: The world's most important being, so he says
text: Today I met the Golf course's IDIOT !!!!
He informed me about his enormous responsibilities, his powerful importance and his authority given by the world's leaders.
Turns out he is the washroom cleaner !!!!!
Oh well

reviews.title: Nice place to play a round.
text: Not a bad course. If it isn't busy (i.e. people ahead of you aren't holding you up), you can do 9 holes in about an hour and a half. Mixture of short and long holes. Three sets of 9 holes, North, East and West cleverly laid out. Greens can be rather tricky on this course.
Not a super-expert course. But if you are an average golfer, you probably will have fun on this course.
Staff are usually pretty friendly. If you show up by yourself, they will often pair you with a couple of others.

reviews.title: Good place to work on your game...
text: Centennial Park.  The park with everything.  Golf, go karting, field sports, skiing, and I think they even fish there.
I go there once in a while for golf practice.  Lord knows that I need the practice!  Ugh.

They have both natural turf and hitting mats.  If you are a beginner, do yourself a fav and hit of the mats.  I think it's around $14 for a large bucket.  Again, beginners please use the mats and play towards the right of the practice area.  If you hit off the grass area and go left, it will not only hit the streets but you might actually hit some active players on the course.

A chipping area and a putting green is also available, as well as their short course.  A course that basically results with many errand shots that might enter the traffic as some hole locations parallel the streets.
If fun is more on the list and less exertion, they have a mini-putt course too.
Have fun and cheers!

reviews.title: Great place for a run!
text: My husband and I were staying at the Double Tree on Dixon and the park was just a quick drive down the street. We came to the park both days for some exercise and really enjoyed ourselves! The first day we went for a 45 min run and the second day we just went back and walked. The running paths were great and the park was very busy with other exercisers and other people doing lots of different activities. This park is an athletes paradise. The park looks well maintained and safe. When back in the area we'll visit again.

reviews.title: Eclectic Mix
text: Centennial Park has a golf course, baseball diamond, kart track, frisbee golf and some nice hills with benches for a scenic view.
Lots of trash around the park.

reviews.title: Royal Woodbine Golf club
text: good course after picking up an underpar coupon for 65$ play anytime with cart. over the course is in good conditions considering the drought we are experiencing. Lots of risk reward holes and fast undulating greens. Good shots are always rewarded to score well, but the creek that runs through the course makes it challenging.
no driving range and there was a putting green by the 18th hole but it was closed that day for maintenance.
we caught a bit of nature that day. one wild hare/rabbit on the front nine and a female coyote with her cub racing across the fairway.

reviews.title: Golf here regularly
text: Great course, great people, great value.  Golf here regularly with friends.  Busy range but can practice chipping and putting while you're waiting.

reviews.title: Fun!
text: Today I practiced chipping, pitching and putting on the greens.  The location was great as it is TTC accessible and parking is available. Inexpensive and lots of fun to practice. Enjoyed it so I will be back there again to practice.

reviews.title: average public course
text: This is an okay public golf course which I often use for practice.  The range is divided in two parts. The first pary is a mat hitting area an a grass hitting area.  Not much grass left as the grass area gets chewed up really fast. The second part is past the club house with a dedicated chipping and putting area.

this is a 27 executive golf course which will allow you to use all the clubs in your bag.  The greens are slow and do not have much break in them. Lots of hackers on this course and hard hats is needed on some holes.
this is a good place to practice your game between rounds and an after work short trip to get out of the house. Also convenient ly located near the major highways.

reviews.title: Cheap public golf course
text: Clever use of property laced with hydro lines but should only be played by golfers on a budget or beginners wanting to try out the game.
Everything about the 'Centre' is basic.
Take a cash helmet for the grass and mats for flying balls and wildly swinging clubs.

reviews.title: Centennial Park has lots to do.
text: Love this park. Great place to run/walk. There's a go-cart track, baseball batting cage, softball/soccer fields, volleyball and a ski lift which I guess works in winter. You may want to check on that.
There is also a free conservatory with plants and flowers.
Large pond with geese and ducks. Several picnic tables and pavilions.
I always try to stay nearby when I travel to Toronto/Mississagua so I can walk in the part in the evening.

reviews.title: Those Hydro Towers!
text: Everthing is great about this course(except thoses hydro towers). The 3 nine hole courses are well kept. Grass is well cut. Greens are very fast. Some of the holes need better direction signage. The parking is huge! Driving range is ok. The chipping and putting green is to die for. Its usually shoulder to shoulder on a busy day. Lots of annual members I meet when I go solo to play. All are friendly. Its a westerly wind swept Parkland style GC. If only if those Hydro Towers weren't there...

reviews.title: Nothing special, uninterested staff and missing tees...
text: Not that I have been to a ton of driving ranges in my day, but I found the Centennial Park Golf Centre to be less than impressive.  The rental clubs given were terrible!  One of them broke and the rest were in rough shape.  When a staff member was told about the club being broken, it was "okay, man."  No apologies, not even a check to make sure where the rest of the club was.  The mats were in decent shape, but many of them were missing tees, which led to a scavenger hunt to lift up other mats to get tees.  Located in Etobicoke, right on the border of Mississauga, the Centennial Park Golf Centre is more for beginners that established golfers.

reviews.title: Driving Range Only
text: Great driving range unless you get there on a Thursday  morning and didn't  know that its closed for maintenance.  Great place to work on your game with a nice range...big chipping green....bunker and a nice putting green.  Very impressed.

reviews.title: ~ 2.5 stars ~
text: ~ 2.5 stars ~
Came here for the team building event for work we tried their Driving range and Mini Golf both were fun to do. The areas were clean and well maintained.
Although the booking service was not good. The person was very helpful in helping us with booking this corporate event and very rude.

reviews.title: Fair course
text: This course is beautiful, especially in autumn.
Rates are quite high and part of the staff is not exactly friendly as one would expect. Still, it's a nice course and work the visit.

reviews.title: Good family fun
text: The mini golf course is fun and just challengeing enough for families. Good value
There is a driving range and golf course there as well.Can't wait for our next visit!

reviews.title: relax,good family fun
text: great family place, mini-putt and driving range. as well as a nice golf coarse. The snack bar is good with reasonable prices.
good access to hwy 401 and 427

reviews.title: Good value on the range and not bad to play
text: Their range fees are very reasonable, and they usually will have both mats and grass available, although the grass areas do fill up quick. They also have both a chipping and putting green available for use too.
Grounds are well maintained, but beware of playing after rain, as it is a low lying area.
There are 3 9 holes courses - and all are quite good considering it's nestled between 3 major highways and an airport.
Green fees are reasonable and it is very easy to walk all of the courses.

reviews.title: Nice course but priced too high
text: For an executive course this establishment charges too much.  Their large bucket of balls is $14 and a round of golf on the weekend is $40 without a cart.

reviews.title: Company Golf Tournament
text: We have had four company golf days here in the past four years.  The course is perfect for beginners and there is something in the park for everyone.
